definitions.definition: More than half (50%) of some group.
definitions.example: The majority agreed that the new proposal was the best.

definitions.definition: The difference between the winning vote and the rest of the votes.
definitions.example: The winner with 53% had a 6% majority over the loser with 47%.
By the time I reached my majority, I had already been around the world twice.

definitions.definition: The office held by a member of the armed forces in the rank of major.
definitions.example: On receiving the news of his promotion, Charles Snodgrass said he was delighted to be entering his majority.
